readop.utility.validator module¶

Contains functionality for validating data types.

readop.utility.validator.validate_bool(value: bool) → bool[source]¶

Validates that the input value is a boolean.

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:TypeError – If the input value was not a bool instance.
readop.utility.validator.validate_credentials(value)[source]¶

Validates that the input value is a valid set of credentials. This requires it to have username and password attributes. The username must be a non-empty string and the password must be a string (potentially empty).

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:AttributeError – If the input value does not have both a username and a password.
readop.utility.validator.validate_int(value: int) → int[source]¶

Validates that the input value is an integer.

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:TypeError – If the input value was not an int instance.
readop.utility.validator.validate_int_geq_zero(value: int) → int[source]¶

Validates that the input value is an integer and greater than or equal to zero.

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:ValueError – If the input value was less than zero.
readop.utility.validator.validate_string(value: str) → str[source]¶

Validates that the input value is a string.

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:TypeError – If the input value was not a str instance.
readop.utility.validator.validate_string_not_empty(value: str) → str[source]¶

Validates that the input value is a string and not empty.

Parameters:value – Value to check.
Returns:The input value if validation was successful.
Raises:ValueError – If the input value was empty.
